docs.lead_paragraph: AUDIO SLIDE SHOW Firefighters at Engine Company 10 in Washington say that about 80 percent of the calls they handle are medical calls, not fires. The firehouse serves one of the city's poorest sections, where few residents have health insurance. nytimes.com/us

docs.lead_paragraph: Seeking to take the offensive as lawmakers prepare to return to work next week, the White House late Thursday sent Congressional Democrats an upbeat analysis of recent public polls on Americans' attitudes toward the president's health care effort.

headline.main: White House Sends Democrats a Peppy Memo on Public Polls

docs.abstract: The White House sends Congressional Democrats an upbeat analysis of recent public polls on attitudes toward the president's effort to overhaul health care.
docs.snippet: The White House sends Congressional Democrats an upbeat analysis of recent public polls on attitudes toward the president's effort to overhaul health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee has a new Web video that accuses Republicans and conservatives of employing "fiction and fear" in the health care debate.

headline.main: Democratic Video Says Republicans Wield 'Fiction and Fear'

docs.abstract: A Web video by the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee accuses Republicans and conservatives of employing "fiction and fear" in the health care debate.
docs.snippet: A Web video by the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee accuses Republicans and conservatives of employing "fiction and fear" in the health care debate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The former chief executive of a UnitedHealth Group insurance subsidiary has come out in support of a government-run public insurance plan. In an op-ed in The Minneapolis Star Tribune, Lois Quam, who ran UnitedHealth's Ovations unit, explains why any health care legislation should include a public option.

headline.main: Former Insurance Executive Supports a 'Public Option'

docs.abstract: In an op-ed, the former chief executive of a UnitedHealth Group insurance subsidiary argues on behalf of a government-run public insurance plan.
docs.snippet: In an op-ed, the former chief executive of a UnitedHealth Group insurance subsidiary argues on behalf of a government-run public insurance plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: When President Obama delivers a health care address to a joint session of Congress next week, one early sign of where things stand may come from watching the applause -- or lack thereof -- from members of Congress.

headline.main: Ben Nelson Still Wants a Bipartisan Bill

docs.abstract: The clap factor: Watch to see whether Senator Ben Nelson, Democrat of Nebraska, applauds Obama's health care speech next week.
docs.snippet: The clap factor: Watch to see whether Senator Ben Nelson, Democrat of Nebraska, applauds Obama's health care speech next week.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the White House announcing that President Obama will jointly address Congress next week, just a few details of the administration's priorities for the speech have emerged.

headline.main: The Early Word: Health Care Makeovers

docs.abstract: How specific will the president be in his speech to Congress?
docs.snippet: How specific will the president be in his speech to Congress?

docs.lead_paragraph: The town-hall-style debate in Pennsylvania on health care Wednesday night was civil and zinger-free. It may or may not have been a preview of next year's Senate race against Arlen Specter. But it certainly showed the high stakes involved in overhauling the health care system.

headline.main: A Civil Health Care Debate by Senate Candidates Who Deeply Disagree

docs.abstract: A town-hall-style debate on health care, by two Senate candidates in Pennsylvania, was civil and zinger-free.
docs.snippet: A town-hall-style debate on health care, by two Senate candidates in Pennsylvania, was civil and zinger-free.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, plans to shine a light Thursday on the particular problems that women face with health insurance. She will join a round-table discussion in Portland, Me., with Representative Chellie Pingree, a Maine Democrat, and officials of AARP and the Maine Women's Lobby.

headline.main: Sebelius to Discuss Women's Problems With Health Insurance

docs.abstract: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, will meet with women's groups in Maine to discuss the particular problems women face with health insurance.
docs.snippet: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, will meet with women's groups in Maine to discuss the particular problems women face with health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many banks are finally back on their feet. The question now is how to keep them there for good. So after propping up lenders with billions of taxpayer dollars, the Obama administration is contemplating long-term measures aimed at preventing, or at least minimizing, any future financial crisis, The New York Times's Eric Dash reported.

headline.main: White House to Propose Big Reserves at Banks

docs.abstract: Many banks are finally back on their feet. The question now is how to keep them there for good. So after propping up lenders with billions of taxpayer dollars, the Obama administration is contemplating long-term measures aimed at least minimizing any future financial crisis.
